ASH FLAT, AR 72513

citations.narrative:
In three enclosures, each with one dog, there were empty water bowls, with no other water available. When water was
presented, the dogs drank for 1-2 minutes. Lack of water could cause the dogs to become dehydrated or other health
issues. Having potable water available continuously is important to the health of the dogs. The licensee must ensure all
dogs have continuous access to potable water.
Corrected during inspection.

The licensee had no documentation that the adult dogs had been vaccinated for Parvo/Distemper in the last 12 months as
directed by the Program of Veterinary Care (PVC). Following the PVC and vaccinating for diseases such as
Parvo/Distemper are necessary to prevent these diseases, which can cause significant harm, to include death. The
licensee must follow the PVC as directed by the Attending Veterinarian for all dogs. The licensee must keep medical
records for the dogs and make the records available to the inspector upon request.
To be corrected by: September 13th, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.10(a) 
   
Watering 
In three enclosures, each with one dog, there were empty water bowls, with no other water available. When water was 
presented, the dogs drank for 1-2 minutes. Lack of water could cause the dogs to become dehydrated or other health 
issues. Having potable water available continuously is important to the health of the dogs. The licensee must ensure all 
dogs have continuous access to potable water.  
Corrected during inspection. 
3.13(a) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee had no documentation that the adult dogs had been vaccinated for Parvo/Distemper in the last 12 months as 
directed by the Program of Veterinary Care (PVC). Following the PVC and vaccinating for diseases such as 
Parvo/Distemper are necessary to prevent these diseases, which can cause significant harm, to include death. The 
licensee must follow the PVC as directed by the Attending Veterinarian for all dogs. The licensee must keep medical 
records for the dogs and make the records available to the inspector upon request. 
To be corrected by: September 13th, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
